Add Reproducible Peak Set to ArchR Project

addReproduciblePeakSet.Rd

This function will get insertions from coverage files call peaks and merge to get a Union Reproducible Peak Set

addReproduciblePeakSet(ArchRProj = NULL, groupBy = "Clusters",
  reproducibility = "2", peaksPerCell = 500, maxPeaks = 150000,
  minCells = 25, excludeChr = c("chrM", "chrY"),
  pathToMacs2 = findMacs2(), genomeSize = NULL, shift = -75,
  extsize = 150, method = "q", cutOff = 0.1, extendSummits = 250,
  promoterDist = 500, genomeAnno = getGenomeAnnotation(ArchRProj),
  geneAnno = getGeneAnnotation(ArchRProj),
  additionalParams = "--nomodel --nolambda", threads = 1,
  parallelParam = "mclapply", force = FALSE, verboseHeader = TRUE,
  verboseAll = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

ArchRProj

ArchRProject
groupBy

use groupings for peak calling matching group coverage files
reproducibility

reproducibility for peak calling (string that is a function of n)
peaksPerCell

number of peaks that can be identified per cell on average
excludeChr

exclude chromosomes from peak calling
pathToMacs2

path to macs2 executable (see Macs2)
genomeSize

genome size for peak calling (see Macs2)
shift

shift of Tn5 insertions (<- | ) (see Macs2)
extsize

extension of Tn5 insertions (|<- ->|) (see Macs2)
method

significance method for Macs2 (see Macs2)
cutOff

significance cutoff for Macs2 (see Macs2)
extendSummits

extend peak summits for final fixed-width peaks
promoterDist

promoter distance from TSS for annotating peaks
genomeAnno

genome annotation for ArchRProject
geneAnno

gene annotation for ArchRProject
additionalParams

additional parameters to pass to Macs2 (see Macs2)
threads

number of threads for parallel execution
parallelParam

parallel parameters for batch style execution
force

force creating peakSet if existed
verboseHeader

verbose sections
verboseAll

verbose sections and subsections
...

additional args

Contents

  • Arguments
